intro: Pimpinella serra, commonly known as the mountain parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in mountainous areas. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pimpinella serra is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
